intro: Kedrostis hirtella, commonly known as the hairy spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically hairy and alternate along the stems. Kedrostis hirtella is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
